TopicTitle: New thumbnails, watch out for the bloat.

Articles.Content:
Logical:

Store thumbnails in the same directory as all your CRAFT files and SFS saves - have them all get deleted when deleting any given save game.

What we got:

Thumbnails are not deleted when save game is deleted, and they are all stored in the same folder "thumbs"...

Squad, I try not to jump on that bandwagon, but you make it very hard...
Oooooh, yeah, that's bad.
Are they deleted when a craft is deleted in game, or do they stay then also?

I have to add, they look great:

![2mND0ke.png](http://i.imgur.com/2mND0ke.png)

![WBAPV0F.png](http://i.imgur.com/WBAPV0F.png)

> 
> Are they deleted when a craft is deleted in game, or do they stay then also?

I've still got some thumbnails in /thumbs for craft which I've deleted. So yeah I guess they just collect up. 

So the question is, do they all get loaded into memory when the game loads or are they loaded as required. Given the way KSP loads all other assets at the start I'm guessing that they just sit there, the ghosts of craft long deleted and forgotten, doomed to forever haunt my RAM.
I observed the same thing. When I updated from 1.0.0 to 1.0.2, I copied over my save directory but found that the thumbnails had been left behind and lost. A bit of an odd architectural choice.
Very odd choice, but they're like 20kb each....why are we moaning...

> 
> Very odd choice, but they're like 20kb each....why are we moaning...

Because 20kB here... 20kB there... it does add up. It is also indicative of a lack of attention to technical details at the developers side. Small things like this that we see leaves us wondering what there may be in there that we don't see.

> 
> Very odd choice, but they're like 20kb each....why are we moaning...

My "thumbs" folder is already over 1.3 mb...

Stupid question, never even thought about thumbnails except when I am clipping them.

What even made you look for them to begin with ?
What I don't like is subassembly categories not being saved to the savegame, so when moving a save to a new KSP install, all subassemblies end up in the "All" category.

> 
> I've still got some thumbnails in /thumbs for craft which I've deleted. So yeah I guess they just collect up. 
> So the question is, do they all get loaded into memory when the game loads or are they loaded as required. Given the way KSP loads all other assets at the start I'm guessing that they just sit there, the ghosts of craft long deleted and forgotten, doomed to forever haunt my RAM.

I hardly think they get loaded, game search for craft files, then for thumb, no thumb and you get the default icon, makes no sense to search for thumb first.

> 
> My "thumbs" folder is already over 1.3 mb...

Seriously this is ridiculous, sure it's dumb and lazy what they did, but we can't honestly be worrying about this amount of data, in any context.

If you want thumbnails for your ships and are not prepared to save a 30kb picture, then why bother playing the game.

I sincerely hope you're being sarcastic.
Can you just delete the thumbnails occasionally? (would this affect my game or would thumbnails regenerate)

> 
> Seriously this is ridiculous, sure it's dumb and lazy what they did, but we can't honestly be worrying about this amount of data, in any context.
> If you want thumbnails for your ships and are not prepared to save a 30kb picture, then why bother playing the game.
> 
> I sincerely hope you're being sarcastic.

Yeah, I'm all for fixing this tiny bug, but the idea of tossing out, "They missed this *glaring* oversight, who *knows* what else the may've mucked up! Really testing us here, Squad," is some teen-drama drudgery. Submit a bug ticket and go outside, kids.

I like the addition, but i think a simple disable thumbnails option would be quite welcome by the community. They also dont get deleted when a ship is deleted for whatevr reason, so i think itd be nice to have any thumbnails tied to a ship thats wiped removed. That said, it is still fine as is, i have a habit of deleting the thumbnails folder once in a while (as i often manually delete ships as well so i might as well get teh corresponding thumbs).
